view_configuration.title: Configuration
view_configuration.message: Export configurations for core Kong Gateway objects, like services, routes, and plugins, to either YAML, JSON, or Terraform. This allows for straightforward importing into APIOps tools like decK with YAML, Insomnia and cURL with JSON, or Terraform products with Terraform.

ace.description: Enable Developer Self-Service for Konnect Dev Portals.

acme.description: Let's Encrypt and ACMEv2 integration with Kong

ai-aws-guardrails.description: The AI AWS GuardRails enables enforcement of introspection with the AWS GuardRails service for all requests processed by the AI Proxy plugin.
ai-aws-guardrails.name: AI AWS GuardRails

ai-azure-content-safety.description: Allows checking and auditing of AI-Proxy plugin messages, using Azure Cognitive Services, before proxying to upstream large-language model.
ai-azure-content-safety.name: AI Azure Content Safety

ai-gcp-model-armor.description: Audit and validate AI Proxy messages with Google Cloud Model Armor before forwarding them to an upstream LLM.
ai-gcp-model-armor.name: AI GCP Model Armor

ai-lakera-guard.description: Audit and enforce safety policies on LLM requests and responses using the AI AWS Lakera plugin before they reach upstream LLMs.
ai-lakera-guard.name: AI Lakera Guard

ai-llm-as-judge.description: Evaluate LLM responses with an external LLM service and use accuracy scores to drive dynamic load balancing for `llm/v1/chat` requests.
ai-llm-as-judge.name: AI LLM Judge

ai-mcp-oauth2.description: Secure MCP server access with OAuth2 authentication.
ai-mcp-oauth2.name: AI MCP OAuth2

ai-mcp-proxy.description: Convert APIs into MCP tools, proxy MCP servers, expose multiple MCP tools, and observe MCP traffic in real time.
ai-mcp-proxy.name: AI MCP Proxy

ai-prompt-compressor.description: The AI Prompt Compressor reduces costs associated with LLMs by compressing prompts.
ai-prompt-compressor.name: AI Prompt Compressor

ai-prompt-decorator.description: Prepend and append chat prompts to AI Proxy plugin LLM requests.
ai-prompt-decorator.name: AI Prompt Decorator

ai-prompt-guard.description: Define a set of valid, and a set of invalid, regular expression patterns when calling LLM models with the AI Proxy plugin.
ai-prompt-guard.name: AI Prompt Guard

ai-prompt-template.description: Define a set of templates, containing string variable placeholders, that can be consumed by users when used with the AI Proxy plugin.
ai-prompt-template.name: AI Prompt Template

ai-proxy.description: Directly call a configured LLM, with mediated security and tuning parameters, and using standardised Kong request and response formats.
ai-proxy.name: AI Proxy

ai-proxy-advanced.description: Route across different LLMs and models using advanced load balancing algorithms, including semantic routing.
ai-proxy-advanced.name: AI Proxy Advanced

ai-rag-injector.description: Attach contextual knowledge from vector databases with flexible template to LLM prompts.
ai-rag-injector.name: AI RAG Injector

ai-rate-limiting-advanced.description: Provides rate limiting for the providers used by any AI plugins.
ai-rate-limiting-advanced.name: AI Rate Limiting Advanced

ai-request-transformer.description: Use an LLM to transform API request from a user, before sending to the upstream service.
ai-request-transformer.name: AI Request Transformer

ai-response-transformer.description: Use an LLM to transform API responses from the upstream service, before returning to the user.
ai-response-transformer.name: AI Response Transformer

ai-sanitizer.description: Sanitize personal or sensitive information from prompts before sending to LLM.
ai-sanitizer.name: AI Sanitizer

ai-semantic-cache.description: Semantically cache AI requests to any LLM to reduce latency, improve end-user experiences and optimize GenAI costs.
ai-semantic-cache.name: AI Semantic Cache

ai-semantic-prompt-guard.description: Semantically and intelligently create allow and deny lists of topics that can be requested across every LLM.
ai-semantic-prompt-guard.name: AI Semantic Prompt Guard

ai-semantic-response-guard.description: Permit or block prompts based on semantic similarity to known LLM responses, preventing misuse of `llm/v1/chat` or `llm/v1/completions` requests.

plugin_configuration.description: Configuration parameters for this plugin. View advanced parameters for extended configuration.

secret_name.label: Secret name
secret_name.help: A unique identifier for this secret in your Datakit configuration

node_panel.title: Node types
node_panel.description: Drag a node onto the canvas to add it to your data flow.

debug.description: Enables detailed error messages in client responses, making debugging easier. See the docs for details.

call.description: Send an HTTP request and retrieve the response.

exit.description: Trigger an early exit that produces a direct response, rather than forwarding a proxied response.

property.name: property

static.summary: Configure static input values ahead of time
static.description: Emits static values to be used as inputs for other nodes. The static node can help you with hardcoding some known value for an input.

branch.name: branch
branch.summary: Execute nodes based on matching input conditions
branch.description: Execute different nodes based on matching input conditions, such as a cache hit or miss.

cache.name: cache
cache.description: Store data into cache and fetch cached data from cache.

request.name: request
request.description: Reads incoming client request properties. You cannot specify request node input.

response.name: response
response.description: Updates properties of the outgoing client response.

service_request.name: service request
service_request.description: Updates properties of the request sent to the service being proxied to.

service_response.name: service response
service_response.description: Reads response properties from the service being proxied to.

input.label: Inputs configuration
input.tooltip: Fields are part of the node input. A source can connect to either the fields or the input, but not both.

vault_picker.component_error: The vault secret picker is not available

free-form.tag_helper: Use comma to separate values. eg: value1, value2

shared_configuration.label: Use shared configuration
shared_configuration.description: Select an existing shared Redis configuration or create a new one. Any updates to this configuration will automatically apply to all associated plugins.
shared_configuration.title: Shared Redis Configuration

dedicated_configuration.label: Use dedicated configuration
dedicated_configuration.description: Create a Redis configuration exclusively for this plugin, with settings that wonâ€™t impact other plugins.

window_type.label: Rate Limit Window Type
window_type.help:
Sets the time window type to either sliding (default) or fixed.
  • Sliding windows apply the rate limiting logic while taking into account previous hit rates (from the window that immediately precedes the current) using a dynamic weight.
  • Fixed windows consist of buckets that are statically assigned to a definitive time range, each request is mapped to only one fixed window based on its timestamp and will affect only that window's counters.

request_limits.title: Request Limits
request_limits.subtitle: Set one or more limits on the number of API requests allowed within a defined timeframe.
request_limits.label: Limit

error_message.label: Error message
error_message.help: Set a custom error code and message to be returned when the rate limit is exceeded.

hourly_500.label: 500 requests every hour
hourly_500.description: A fixed limit of 500 requests per hour resetting sharply on the hour, ensuring no user can exceed this limit.

half_hourly_200.label: 200 requests every 30 minutes
half_hourly_200.description: Users are allowed 200 requests per 30 minutes, resetting exactly on the 30 minute mark with no carryover of unused limits.

daily_500.label: 500 requests every day
daily_500.description: A strict limit of 5000 requests per day resetting promptly at midnight, preventing any burst traffic or inconsistent user experiences.

hourly_100.label: 100 requests every hour
hourly_100.description: Maximum of 100 requests every rolling hour, continuously adjusting the count over the course of the hour. No hard limit or known reset.

half_hourly_300.label: 300 requests every 30 minutes
half_hourly_300.description: Each user can make up to 300 requests in any rolling 30 minute period, with older requests dropping off as new requests are made.

hourly_500.label: 500 requests every hour
hourly_500.description:
Each user is allowed 500 requests per hour. 
If the limit is exceeded and the user receives a 429 error, each additional request within the sliding window (hour) 
will extend the wait time by about 12 minutes, continuously adjusting as new requests are made.
